name: SayWhatISay
0:
”Alexa, open Say What I Say.”
”Repeat after me, you are the best.”
”Change accent to British male.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: say what i say
des:
Have you always wanted to get Alexa to say certain things? With this skill you can tell Alexa to say almost anything you can think of! You can also hear Alexa translate your phrase from English to a different language! This skill will also allow you to select between 30+ different voices and many different voice modes to repeat your phrase! You can change Alexa's accent and have her talk like a British Male! You can also have Alexa talk fast, slow, with a high voice, or a low voice, backwards, in reverse, whispering, in a drunk voice, as a robot, spelling out words, and saying words with random beeps! Try it out and have tons of fun!

This skill is also helpful if you want to practice your language skills. You can translate your phrase from English to a few other different languages. After translating you can hear the translation repeated slower by saying, "say it again slow" or "say it again really slow". You can also view the translation in your Alexa app.

How it works:
Tell Alexa to repeat your phrase by saying, "repeat after me". Next, you can tell her what to say.
After she tells you the phrase, you can have her repeat it by saying, "say it again".
You can change the way she says the phrase by saying something like, "say it again fast".
To change her accent, say something like "change accent to British male", or just say "change accent" for a random accent.
After you tell her a phrase, you can also tell her to translate it to another language! (Currently max of 10 translations per week)

Below are some examples on how to translate a phrase, change the accent, or change the voice mode.

Translating a phrase:
First start by saying "repeat after me". Then tell Alexa your phrase.
After she hears and remembers the phrase, you can say something like, "translate to German".
This skill allows you to translate from English to the following languages: English, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, and Spanish.
To hear your original phrase, you can say something like, what was my original phrase?
To hear the last translated phrase, say something like, what was my last translation.
You can also view the translation in your Alexa app to check for accuracy.
*Note: There is currently a max of 10 translations per week. This is subject to change.
*Note: Due to the nature of voice and translation technology, translations may not always be accurate. Always check translations before using.

Changing Accents:
For a list of accents, say "list accents".
Just say "change accent to" followed by the name of an accent.
Available Accents - Alexa, American male (1, 2), American female (1, 2, 3, 4), Australian male, Australian female, British male, British female (1, 2), French male, French female (1, 2, 3), German male, German female (1, 2), Indian female (1, 2), Italian male, Italian female (1, 2), Japanese male, Japanese female, Portuguese male, Portuguese female (1, 2), Spanish male (1, 2), Spanish female (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), boy, girl

Changing Voice Modes:
For a list of voice modes, say "list voice modes".
Just say "say it again", followed by the name of the voice mode.
Available Voice Modes - fast, slow, high, low, backwards, rewind, whisper, beep, spelled out, robot, drunk, valley girl, random
*Note: Whisper mode only works for certain voices.

Alexa will also include her own random comments before reciting your phrase. To turn these off, you can say "Turn off comments".
You can also turn off hint prompts, which are mentioned after your phase is repeated by saying something like, "Turn hints off".
priv:
Developer Privacy Policy
The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
